reviews:
['As soon as I entered the room, I was greeted with a strong cigarette smoke. I immediately asked to change to another room: the new room was somehow better, although it smelled of cigarette smoke throughout my stay as well (albeit less strong).
I think this hotel should invest in "addressable" cigarette smoke detectors: you place one in every room. Then, when an alarm is triggered, the security guard will see exactly in which room the guest is smoking and will be able to go to that room.

The AC was very dirty (see the picture attached). I lay in bed without the blanket, with the AC set to 16 degrees and maximum fan speed, but I was still sweating. It is high time they called an AC maintenance professional and had their AC cleaned and cooling gas refilled.

The environment is noisy: the biggest issue isn't even the road traffic but a nearby business playing music until 10 p.m.

Wi-Fi was weak and would almost disconnect (see the screenshot attached). Yet, I was using the Wi-Fi hotspot of my floor, not another floor. Watching a movie proved impossible: it would freeze all the time.

The only positive side to my stay was the extremely attentive and polite receptionist lady.', None, 'Kh√°ch s·∫°n cao c·∫•p, ph·ª•c v·ª• nhi·ªát t√¨nh,nh√¢n vi√™n d·ªÖ th∆∞∆°ng!']

address: 16 ƒê∆∞·ªùng s·ªë 7A, B√¨nh Tr·ªã ƒê√¥ng B, B√¨nh T√¢n, Th√†nh ph·ªë H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vi·ªát Nam
district: B√¨nh T√¢n, Th√†nh ph·ªë H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
amenities: ['Wi-Fi mi·ªÖn ph√≠', 'B·ªØa s√°ng mi·ªÖn ph√≠', 'D·ªãch v·ª• gi·∫∑t ·ªßi']
reviews:
["I had a most comfortable stay here. I arrived shortly before 7 pm: the man and the lady working at reception even helped me carry my luggage up the stairs, to the reception. That was an amazing welcome. The man then accompanied me to the room and checked that the AC worked and that hot water was there. That was great.
The room was very comfy: the bed was good. Plus, there was a fridge and very comfortable chairs and a table. Cleaning is done by request, which suits me very well, because most times I don't need cleaning and prefer my room not to be entered. The staff speak a little English. To sum up, I would stay here again if I pass by Saigon again.

As to the downsides, I went out for dinner that same evening. When I came back and as I was waiting for the lift to arrive, I smelled a strong smell of cigarette smoke in the reception area. Having looked out, I saw that the late-evening/night receptionist was smoking in the reception area.
There is a also a big dark-coloured dog that sometimes comes to sit on the stairs, making it difficult to enter.
And yes, regarding the stairs: I'm young and capable, but I just think of elderly or disabled people: they will not be able to climb that flight of stairs. Meaning this hotel can't accommodate elderly or disabled people.
There was dust on the bedside lamp. And the shower holder was broken when I checked in: I had to hold the shower in my hand at all times when showering. I checked in shortly before 7 pm - I think that since the check-out of the previous guest, there was plenty of time to go to a plumbing shop and buy a new holder.
Lastly, Wi-Fi was mostly OK, but sometimes (especially in the evening) it would stop working.", None, 'Za≈ô√≠zen√≠ star√© a hluƒçn√©. Do centra je to daleko asi hodinu tax√≠kem. Nejhor≈°√≠ je v≈°ak hygiena. Matrace jsou viditelnƒõ plesniv√© a mysl√≠m ≈æe jsem z toho dostal vyr√°≈æku na noze. Na pokoji nebyl ani hajzlpapir.']

["Meander Saigon is an absolute gem, and Julian's exceptional hospitality is a huge reason why I extended.
From the moment I arrived, I felt welcomed and at ease. The whole team is incredibly helpful and friendly, but Julian truly went above and beyond.
He even helped me with late-night bookings when I needed assistance!

The hostel itself is fantastic. It's a beautiful space with a cool, social vibe. And yes, the slide is as fun as it looks! The location is perfect for exploring Saigon, with everything within easy reach.

I can't recommend Meander Saigon enough, especially if you're lucky enough to meet Julian during your stay. It's easily the best hostel in Saigon!

reviews:
['Sehr liebe Mitarbeiter dort. Haben mir geholfen bei einem Problem mit einem Taxifahrer. Zimmer absolut OK. Kann ich nur weiter empfehlen :)', 'Wir haben uns sehr wohl gef√ºhlt und w√ºrden jedem die Unterkunft weiterempfehlen. Die Gastgeberin ist sehr, sehr nett - wir haben uns wie zu Hause gef√ºhlt. Sehr hilfsbereit, aber nicht aufdringlich und vor allem sehr herzlich.

Unser Zimmer war sehr sch√∂n eingerichtet und hatte einen kleinen Balkon, was viel Licht in das Zimmer gebracht hat und eine sch√∂ne Stimmung erzeugt hat.

Die Zimmer und das Hotel allgemein war sehr sauber und gepflegt. Au√üerdem kann man dort seine W√§sche kostenlos waschen, Wasser wird gestellt genauso wie Shampoo und Duschgel.

Die Lage ist etwas au√üerhalb vom Stadtzentrum allerdings befinden sich direkt in der Nebenstra√üe einige s√º√üe Caf√©s. Wir k√∂nnen bspw coffe hut, coconut cofe (cafe & boutiquegesch√§ft in einem), okyio cafe.
Falls ihr dort seid, holt euch auf jeden Fall eine Kokosnuss und ein Orangensaft neben dem veganen Bahn mi um die Ecke von der Stra√üenverk√§uferin. Wir waren dort jeden Tag, weil das so lecker und frisch war. ü§§

Obwohl die Lage nicht im Zentrum war, kann man sich g√ºnstig ein Grab holen oder auch in 30 Minuten in die Stadt laufen.

Vielen Dank f√ºr alles. Wir hatten eine tolle Zeit.', "I had the pleasure of staying at Tito Homestay in Ho Chi Minh City this past week, and I can confidently say it was one of the highlights of my trip. From the moment I stepped into the homestay, I was greeted with warmth and hospitality that truly made me feel at home.

Location: Nestled in a vibrant part of the city, Tito Homestay is perfectly positioned. It's close enough to the bustling markets, historic sites, and nightlife, yet it offers a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Getting around was a breeze, with several local attractions within walking distance and easy access to Grab transport for further explorations.

Accommodation: The rooms are a blend of comfort and style. The decor reflects a tasteful mix of modern amenities with traditional Vietnamese touches, creating an inviting atmosphere. My room was spotlessly clean, with a comfortable bed that ensured a good night's sleep after days of exploration. The air conditioning was a godsend during the hot afternoons, and the Wi-Fi was fast and reliable, which was crucial for staying connected.

Hospitality: The staff at Tito Homestay deserve special mention. Their friendliness and readiness to assist with any query or need were exceptional. Their knowledge of the city's hidden gems was invaluable.

Value for Money: Considering the location, service, and the quality of the accommodations, Tito Homestay offers excellent value. It's an affordable option without compromising on comfort or convenience, making it ideal for travelers looking to experience Ho Chi Minh City authentically without breaking the bank.

Additional Perks: The rooftop area houses a washing machine. It's use was included.

In conclusion, my stay at Tito Homestay was memorable for all the right reasons. Whether you're a solo traveler, a couple, or a small group, this homestay provides a welcoming, comfortable base from which to explore this dynamic city. I would definitely recommend Tito Homestay to anyone visiting Ho Chi Minh City and look forward to returning on my next trip.

Thank you very much, I look forward to seeing you next year!"]

reviews: ['Cannot complain', 'This is more like Airbnb instead of a hotel, ground floor is Rovis Coffee shop instead of lobby or counter, there is no receptionist here, the manager will try to contact you by WhatsApp or other IM. The room is bigger, comfortable with well renovation, also with kitchen wares and stove, convenient if you would like to cook or heat foods. There is washing machine and dryer machine in roof floor, this is more convenient if you plan to stay here longer time. The location of this hotel is very good, near by War Remnants Museum and Independent Palace, just few minutes walk distance, also have many restaurants around this area, actually I have nice time here even this is not a regular hotel.', 'I originally booked this hotel on Expedia. But after getting a second look, I realized it might be a ghost/fake hotel. If you look on Google map street view, the hotel is not visible. And the hotels photos are all generic and don‚Äôt look legit. Instead of arriving and potentially not have a hotel exist there, I canceled, got refunded and booked at another hotel, who‚Äôs photos clearly stated their name, the Google street view showed the hotel and the name. Please do your research to not get scammed.']

['It was great from the moment we checked-in with T√†i at the front desk. He was nice, helpful & friendly. The 1 bedroom suite we had was perfect at the end of the hall. Large, bright, clean living, bath & bed rooms with large walk-in glass door shower. Kitchen & fridge were just right size, large TV in living & bed rooms. Breakfast is good & very reasonable, particularly if you reserve it with reservation online. Nice pool on roof. Highly recommend & we‚Äôll be back.

Returned for a few more days after trip to different city in Vietnam. Chose a smaller room without a separate bed & living rooms and just as nice and more than enough for a couple. But the bed is queen not king sized.

...NOT WORTH THE PRICE üò¨üò¨

Day 1: had no hot water AND water was not working for some of the taps AND the shower did not switch to the top showerhead it stayed at the bottom tap level (i squatted to take a shower and washed my hair in the basin ‚úåÔ∏èüíÄ) the rooms did not match the photos (smaller/dirtier/not as furnished nicely as the advetising)

Day 2: Parking costs money every time you enter and exit... so you can't go anywhere unless you have a solid parking situation

reviews: ['Nh√† ƒë·∫πp', 'Nh√† ƒë·∫πp,sang trong, l·ªãch s·ª±', "The Moana House is in my opinion one of the best ways to stay in HCMC. Close to the airport, as close to the sights as eg. the War Remants Museum or the post office. Everything to walk in about 30 minutes, or in 10 minutes and about 15 - 20k VND reachable with the Grabbike! The accommodation is very well maintained and clean, it is cleaned daily and fresh towels every day! A very well functioning air conditioning, hot shower, very clean bathroom and large rooms with natural light and a small balcony! And all for a very reasonable price! amenities: ['Wi-Fi mi·ªÖn ph√≠', 'B·ªØa s√°ng mi·ªÖn ph√≠', 'ƒê·ªó xe mi·ªÖn ph√≠', 'C√≥ ƒëi·ªÅu h√≤a nhi·ªát ƒë·ªô', 'D·ªãch v·ª• gi·∫∑t ·ªßi']
reviews:
['I was extremely dissatisfied with my staying on 19 to 24 October, 25. The attitude of the front desk staff named Hung. He was arrogant and condescending when talking to guests about the hotel‚Äôs policy. Although I explained that when booking through the app, it clearly stated that only a passport or ID was required, and I even showed him both documents, he insisted that without showing him a picture of my visa, I would not be allowed to check in ‚Äî and he did so with a very rude and bossy attitude.
Because of this, one of my family members had to leave an important meeting just to go back and take a picture of my visa for him, since I was too far away to do it myself. I had to wait for a long time to check in after a long flight, which was extremely inconvenient.
However, when I later saw the hotel‚Äôs policy posted in the room, it clearly DID NOT MENTION ANY REQUIREMENT TO PROVIDE A VISA (see photos attached), contrary to what he demanded. How dare he did that to me?

I strongly urge the hotel management to take action to correct this staff member‚Äôs unprofessional and disrespectful behavior. The hotel should also not arbitrarily change its policies without informing guests prior to booking.

The hotel itself lacked proper amenities ‚Äî the air conditioning was weak and did not cool the room sufficiently. Next to the hotel was an empty lot filled with trash, emitting a foul smell. This is something guests would never know until they arrive.
Please think carefully before booking this place. There are many other hotels nearby with similar prices but much better quality and service ‚Äî especially staff who know how to speak to guests professionally, unlike the receptionist at YoYo Hotel, the polluted environment and poor service attitude.', 'I booked this place in advance and the day we were supposed to check in, they claimed to have an electric outage and asked to switch us to their sister hotel instead. The place was also close to the airport so I thought nothing of it but once we came to the Yoyo Airport Hotel the quality of the room was so much lower than Yoko Hotel. The bathroom smelled moldy, the elevator doesn‚Äôt go up to our room so we had to carry our luggage up the stairs and most importantly the door lock wasn‚Äôt working. It didn‚Äôt feel safe to be there so I asked to cancel and they tried to switch us to another one called Red Sun Hotel which had an even lower rating. They said we can cancel on Agoda if we‚Äôd like but they won‚Äôt be returning our payment. This felt scammy but we knew there was nothing we could do so we just sucked it up for the night. I would never book this place again.', None]

reviews:
['The rooms are not clean, and there's this lingering unpleasant smell. Our shower had black mold in it, the drain was clogged, and the towels didn't really dry you. Honestly, I felt dirtier after my shower‚Äîwhich is super unpleasant after a long flight.

The hotel is in a super busy side street which makes it pretty hard and inconvenient to get to and out of.

The hotel markets itself as premium, but it just isn't; you can get a nicer place for much cheaper if you get away from the airport area a little bit.

A huge red flag that they don't show online is that they rent rooms by the hour and they offer a discount if you pay for two hours...so, that tells you who their primary clients are, because there're only so many reasons people would need a hotel room for only two hours üò≥. Which honestly explains the grimy feeling.

The staff are also flippant and patronizing. If you understand Vietnamese, you'll catch what I mean: lots of comments about how rich you must be and how much money you must have since you're staying at a "nice" hotel. It's quite uncomfortable riding the elevator with staff who won't stop talking about how rich you are, because you know..you're not, but they keep thinking you are. It gives you the ick. And! When I got to my room, it turns out staff were using it as their own room just seconds before.

If you like black mold, seedy neighbors, sewer smells, and eyes staring at you like you're walking an open purse/wallet, then this is the place for you. If you'd rather just relax, then go anywhere else. Anywhere at all.', 'D·∫°, t√¥i xin tr·∫£ l·ªùi r·∫±ng:
Kh√°ch s·∫°n t·ªët, ƒë·∫πp,
, ƒë·ªì gi·∫∑t m·∫Øc v√† ko th∆°m', 'Walking distance from Sai Goan international and domestic terminal. Budget hotel. No restaurant available in the hotel.']
